title: Public transport for ATSA Independent Living Expo: Tuesday 20 and Wednesday 21 May 2025
articleContent:
The ATSA Independent Living Expo will be coming to Melbourne at the Melbourne Showgrounds! Public transport is your best way to enjoy it, with extra services to help you get to and from the Melbourne Showgrounds on Tuesday 20 and Wednesday 21 May.
The event will run:

  • Tuesday 20 May: 8am to 4.30pm
  • Wednesday 21 May: 8.30am to 3pm

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey planner. Check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

Please visit the event website for further event information here.

Tuesday 20 and Wednesday 21 May

 Metropolitan train

Getting to and from Melbourne Showgrounds

Trains will operate from Flinders Street (Platform 8/9), Southern Cross (Platform 13/14), stopping at North Melbourne (Platform 5/6), then express to Melbourne Showgrounds (Platform 1) in both directions.

  • From 8.55am, services will operate every 40 minutes.

The last train to depart from Melbourne Showgrounds will depart at 3.35pm.

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from Flemington Racecourse

Route 57 

  • Trams will operate via Route 57 between Stop 1: Flinders Street / Elizabeth Street, stopping via Stop 32: Sandown Road/ Epsom Road via Flemington Road for passengers wishing to go to the expo.

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

 Metropolitan bus

Getting to and from Melbourne Showgrounds

The following bus route travels close to Melbourne Showgrounds:

  • Route 472 (Williamstown to Moonee Ponds via Footscray)

Passengers can catch buses from Footscray Station and alight at Langs Road/Showgrounds.

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

 Regional train

Getting to Melbourne Showgrounds

Passengers arriving at North Melbourne and Southern Cross stations are advised to change trains and catch a Melbourne Showgrounds service.

Refer to the Metropolitan trains section above for service times and platform information.

Leaving the Melbourne Showgrounds

Passengers are advised to catch any train from Melbourne Showgrounds and alight at Southern Cross or North Melbourne stations and change to a regional train.

Refer to the Metropolitan train section above for service times.

Additional information 

  • Check Disruptions for any service changes that may affect your journey to and from the event.
  • Plan your journey using Journey planner.
  • Download our free mobile apps for Android and iOS to get public transport information on the go. You can also top up your myki instantly in the app.
  • If you need accessibility information and assistance, see Accessibility.
  • Top up your myki before travelling or set Auto Top Up so you never need to top up again. For more information, see Auto Top Up.
  • Mobile myki is a new way to travel with myki. It’s a digital myki on your Android phone on the Google WalletTM app.
  • For information about tickets for children and concessions, see Children and Concessions.
  • If you need more information or special assistance, please call 1800 800 007 before travelling.

Subscribe for weekly travel updates

Keep up to date with planned disruptions on your line/route and across the network by subscribing to our weekly travel update email.

Follow us on social media

For news, inspiration, hints and tips on Victoria’s public transport network, follow us on Facebook.
